description: The other download on flathub gave me issues but using the official launcher actually works
Veloren updates constantly and the other version may stay outdated and cause issues.
summary: Great game, use this launcher over the other flathub package

description: Fun game to play. Gliding is the way to get around.
summary: Fun, Fast, and still in developement

description: Started playing this to get an idea of what Rust could make and what the Rust OS community was like. It's an amazing effort! It has reasonably complex world gen and crafting. It's progressing at a healthy clip and I can't wait to see it take off for the 1.0 release. It's also got a great community both players and developers.
summary: Really fun game with loads more content than minecraft

description: It's not launching for months now. Either needs update or broken.
The view is impressive, what a beautiful game
I hope for more games like this for Linux

I'm using Fedora 37 Kinoite and the launcher immediately crashes on Wayland session. Using flatseal and disabling "Wayland windowing system," forces it to default to XWayland and the game launches fine.
Veloren is a super cool RPG version of Minecraft. It's still in alpha development, but they already have servers you can go join and play on. Running amazingly smoothly and looks downright gorgeous.
Runs really well and its also pretty cool. A little lacking since its in pre-alpha but it's very promising.

Veloren by itself is a great RPG with the Multiplayer aspect having MMO-like potential. I actually do think this game could turn out to be a successful MMORPG down the road. The New Player experience could really use some work as new players won't know what they're supposed to do. I haven't fully explored all of the current game content but even I started off with just running around before understanding I needed to craft things to get better gear. Like most RPGs, I'm used to having some kind of objective to follow so this was that one change that threw me off just a little. But I guess I'll continue referring to the game's online manual which also could use more work.

The Airshipper launcher for Veloren is alright, but under Wayland and especially as a Flatpak carries a lot of issues. The native Wayland port for Airshipper introduces a non-native window decoration and sometimes crashes when changing the launch settings. In Veloren, the native Wayland port has weird mouse issues and it doesn't stay locked in the game. And since I currently use the Flatpak version, the example command given for fetching server latency doesn't work at all. But I still manually pinged each server outside of the launcher and found which one I needed to play on.

All issues aside, I still keep coming back to the game. I even stream the game once in a while. I like the direction the team is going with it and I will continue to support it however I can!
Game is cool, devs are cringe, but game != devs, so it's cool.
summary: A Rusty Venture for the whole family!
